This IRM is new and should be used with IRM 3.30.19, Production Control and Performance Reporting and 3.30.50, Project PCA Production Control Accounting by Reports Teams to process WP&C data.
The Reports Teams that update and correct WP&C data used in creation of performance and production reports.
Teams Instructions for Work Planning and 3.30.18
Instructions for Work Planning and page (
) This IRM includes instructions for Reports Teams that perform support functions for Integrated Management Planning and Information System (IMPIS), Work Planning and Control (WP&C). (
) Support functions include adjustment of performance and production informa- tion, veriﬁcation of report data, balancing of reports, and maintenance of databases. (
) WP&C is utilized for workload and resource planning by many of the Operation Divisions (BOD’s). Refer to IRM
, IMPIS Overview for a complete list of BOD’s that utilize WP&C. (

) Two mainframe Unisys computers, one at Enterprise Computing Center MCC) located in Martinsburg, West Virginia and the second at Enterprise Computing Center (ECC-MEM) located in Memphis, Tennessee support processing. Each mainframe is partitioned with ﬁve separate operating processes that create a total of ten sets of WP&C reports. Data sent to each the mainframe computers is divided by an Employee Master File (EMF) Indicator or by a Service Center Code. (

) WP&C encompasses four separate component systems, Project PCA tion Control and Accounting (PCA), Project PCB Workload Scheduling (PCB), Project PCC Production Control and Performance Reporting (PCC), and Project PCD Control Data Analysis(PCD). (

) Project PCA Production Control and Accounting and Project PCC Production Control and Performance Reporting are overseen by Submission Processing, Program Management Process Assurance Branch, Quality Section (SE:W:CAS:SP:PM:Q). Reports Team Managers should refer issues with Project PCA and Project PCC procedures and reports to the Submission Pro- cessing Headquarters WP&C Coordinator. (

) Project PCB Workload Scheduling is overseen by Submission Processing, Program Management Process Assurance Branch, Resource Section (SE:W:CAS:SP:PM:R). Reports Team Managers should refer issues with scheduled (Project PCB) receipts and production information in WP&C to the Submission Processing Headquarters WP&C Coordinator. (

) Project PCD Control Data Analyses is overseen by Submission Processing, Program Management Process Assurance Branch, Monitoring Section (SE:W:CAS:SP:PM:M). Reports Team Managers should refer issues with Project PCC reports balancing related to Project PCD data and procedures the Submission Processing Headquarters WP&C Coordinator. (
) In the past Project PCE Individual Quality Review, was also supported by the Reports Teams. Project PCE became obsolete in October,
when the Evaluation Performance System (TEPS) became obsolete. As a result, all processes and procedures relating to Project PCE have been discontinued. (
) This IRM is to be used in conjunction with IRM
, Production Control and Performance Reporting and IRM
, Project PCA Production Accounting. Important explanations, information, and instructions are in these IRMs. Internal Revenue Manual
Work Planning and (

) Reports created by the four mainframe computer projects are numbered the ﬁrst three alphabetical digits of the report indicate what project (or the computer run that creates the report. For example, PCC-
is the weekly Managers Report created from the weekly Project PCC run. (

) Mainframe output (reports) created include information listings, error and reports used to monitor resource and production information. Lists of output can be found in the section of this IRM for each Project. (

) The PCC daily reports have control records that tell mainframe what organization and/program codes to print on the report. PCC weekly reports have control records that tell mainframe how to compile or roll-up data. (

) PCA and PCC reports have date records that are maintained by Technology. These records or “date cards” as they are referred to, tell the mainframe what date to put on the report and how to compile the data. (

) Where procedures reference a day or days, those days are always to be sidered work days unless otherwise speciﬁed as calendar days. Work days business days are deﬁned as non-holiday Monday through Friday days, otherwise speciﬁed. (
) When Monday falls on a holiday, WP&C weekly processing is moved one from Monday and Tuesday to Tuesday and Wednesday. (
) IRM deviations must be submitted in writing following instructions from IRM
, Internal Management Documents System - Internal Revenue (IRM) Process, IRM Standards, and elevated through appropriate channels executive approval. (
) It is the responsibility of the user of information from the Project PCA protect Personally Identiﬁable Information (PII) from unauthorized use, disclosure or sharing (IRM
, Privacy and Information Protection, Policy). (

) This IRM cannot address every possibility that may arise while adjusting, verifying and maintaining WP&C reports. It may be necessary to refer the to your designated Subject Matter Expert (SME), lead and/or manager to determine the proper corrective action. (
) Verify all output from WP&C daily and weekly runs are loaded to Control-D, that reports are dated correctly and contain the accurate input ﬁles. (
) Prepare, review and monitor posting of employee salary information to the Employee Master File (EMF) via personnel actions received from (

) Review, maintain, and update children function and program codes in the (Organization Function Program) Consistency File. (
) Review, maintain, and monitor posting of individual performance data.
